g.text: Implement a release system. One option is to use
releases. You can obtain a DOI for each release via
Perform the release and tag it
Update the README to include the DOI identifier
provides in the “how to cite” section
Set up continuous integration (CI) tools (examples include
, Travis CI, etc. against pull requests)
coveralls) can help establish that tests
cover the entire codebase and publish test status (pass/fail, test
Check for consistent code formatting; a format checker (e.g.,
Python black) can be used to check the formatting of pull requests and/or
Add Documentation pages (e.g., HTML documentation). Documents
can be deployed at several places (e.g.,
Getting started. Provide simple instructions to install the code
and run a sample problem. Links here to Tutorials.
Examples / Tutorials. Links here to illustrations of using the code.
API reference. Links here to the documentation of each public
Class, function and/or method. Note that this can typically be
Release notes. Links here to logs of changes with each tagged
, or other easy install code service.
